attributes.action: Stop New Builds Being Built In Clitheroe & Ribble Valley For The Next 10 Years
attributes.background:
Stop housing developers destroying everything around us. Preserve our green fields for the next 10 years.
Stop Anymore New Builds Being Built In Clitheroe & Ribble Valley Now, as the town and villages are suffocating with the sheer amount of new houses being built & insufficient infrastructure.
attributes.additional_details:
Are you fed up of.. seeing housing developers destroy green field after green field?
Or seeing public footpaths lost for good?
Of various animals and wildlife losing their habitat?
How about the relentless sets of temporary roadworks?
The 4 week wait to see a GP as the surgery is full to bursting? (And no new health centres being built)
Permanent traffic jams?
Construction traffic churning up the roads?
Or developers winning every single appeal, if their application is rejected?

rejection.details:
Planning decisions for your area are the responsibility of Ribble Valley Borough Council. If you wished to share your concerns with the Council, you can find out how to do this here: https://www.ribblevalley.gov.uk/info/200393/have_your_say.

You could also contact your MP and ask them to take action on your behalf. You can find their contact details by entering your post code here: https://members.parliament.uk/FindYourMP.

attributes.action: Stop off-road vehicles ruining our countryside.More policing & stiffer penalties
attributes.background: Section 34 Road Traffic Act 1988 needs enforcing more strictly with arrests, bigger fines, vehicle confiscation & prosecutions to deter the huge increase in recreational off-road vehicle usage on grazing/common land which is damaging the livestock, our wildlife, environment and rural communities
attributes.additional_details: Local wildlife, farmers, communities have relied on moorlands for generations and these vital peatlands are under threat with livestock unable to graze safely now. These illegal, vehicle users are shredding moorland to pieces. This problem has grown over the years and the increase is mainly adults using our moorland to exercise off-road bikes/4x4s and has now reached an overwhelming level.The huge increase in this illegal activity is damaging breeding grounds and the environment to a huge level

rejection.details:
Driving a 'mechanically propelled' vehicle on moorland is already an offence under the Road Traffic Act 1988, so it's not clear how you would like the law to be changed nor what you mean by 'stiffer penalties'. 

Further, enforcement of the law is a matter for the Police, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could start a petition calling for increased minimum sentences for offences under Section 34 of the Road Traffic Act, if that's something you'd like to happen.

attributes.action: Make the use of Bee killing pesticides in the UK illegal.
attributes.background: A bee-killing poisonous pesticide that it is banned for use in the EU has now been permitted by the UK government to be used by farmers in England. Environment secretary George Eustice has agreed for the pesticide containing the neonicotinoid thiamethoxam to be used to protect sugar beat yields.
attributes.additional_details: The decision to allow farmers to use this pesticide must be reversed as a matter of urgency to protect fragile biodiversity in the UK. The government should be doing everything in its power to protect bees as a result of the biodiversity crisis which states that half the planets insects have disappeared. We are in the midst of a climate emergency and the use of this pesticide will make all efforts to protect wildlife so far futile.   Protecting Bees guarantees the future of our planet.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Overturn the decision to allow the use of neonicotinoid pesticides
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569214

Continue the ban on the use of Neonicotinoids
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/563943

attributes.action: Protect Ring necked Parakeets in the UK
attributes.background: Stop culling of these birds
attributes.additional_details: because they offer such a variety to local wildlife

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566350

attributes.action: Ban the sale of fireworks to the public.
attributes.background:
They can only be bought by a person licensed by local authority for a organised display. Organised displays will have set standards about amount of space and safety requirements e.g first aiders.
Other dates need a permit where proximity to wildlife and residences will be considered (weddings)
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks sold to the public mean they go off for many days around key dates. Many animals are afraid of them both domestic and wild. There have also been cases of people attaching fireworks to other people’s pets. Fireworks used by inexperienced people or those under the influence also create risk of injury to those using them and around them. They also cause additional litter where they land. Key dates and organised displays with safety measures in place should be the standard.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Limit the Sale and Use of Fireworks to Organisers of Licensed Displays Only
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319891

Stop the sale of fireworks to the general public.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/557780

attributes.action: Professional usage of fireworks only, unless pre-approval sought by public
attributes.background:
Parliament should ensure that fireworks cannot be accessed by members of the public, unless pre-approval is sought from their local council.
Fireworks used in a professional way, with pre-approval, mean the public are pre-warned and can put things in place to lessen the impact of the loud noises.
attributes.additional_details:
Fireworks disturb wildlife, pets and normal family routines.
Fireworks cause distress to pets, with nervousness (barking, shaking, stress) and bolting two of the main issues.
Fireworks harm nesting birds and wildlife. It is not just loud noises but the litter and potential for misuse to cause fire damage too.
Fireworks disrupt families as they are not restricted to specific times, so young children who are scared of the noises find it difficult to settle, which causes distress.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what the approval process with councils would require.  
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, or you might like to sign and share this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332906

attributes.action: Ban noisy fireworks.
attributes.background:
They are a threat to wildlife, domestic animals are air pollutants and cause fear to some children,  especially autistic children. 
We watch in awe at Sir D Attenborough's attempts to care for our environment and then bombard our wildlife with petrifying noise
attributes.additional_details: It's 2020. We banned using animals at the circus as it was considered a form of cruelty.  It's now time to move away from barbarism of noisy fireworks

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549758

attributes.action: Ban fireworks that bang, they frighten pets, wildlife and are noise pollution.
attributes.background: Ban the production and sale of fireworks that go bang.
attributes.additional_details: Anyone with a cat or dog knows that loud fireworks are frightening to their pets. Loud fireworks frighten wildlife. Loud fireworks are noise pollution to people trying to lead a peaceful life. Why should we have to put up with the noise so some people can enjoy making as much noise as they can? Firework bangs seem to get louder each year and people seem to be letting off fireworks weeks before November 5th and weeks afterward.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549758

While some fireworks are marketed as silent, these still make some noise. If you would like the Government to reduce the decibel limit to a specific level, you could start a new petition requesting this.

We have also published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Limit the Sale and Use of Fireworks to Organisers of Licensed Displays Only: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319891

Ban the use of all fireworks in order to reduce air and noise pollution: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334448

attributes.action: STOP OR LIMIT the sale of fireworks
attributes.background: Pets and wildlife are negatively affected with the use of fireworks, at times even causing death.
attributes.additional_details:
Ban sales of fireworks to general public
Fireworks to be used only at organised events

rejection.details:
You might like to sign one or more of the following petitions:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319891

Stop the sale of fireworks to the general public.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/557780

Ban the use of all fireworks in order to reduce air and noise pollution.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334448

attributes.action: Up conservation efforts to protect native bee populations from going extinct.
attributes.background: Increase Government funding for conservation groups trying to protect bees native to the UK to help secure the their future as a species.
attributes.additional_details: Bees are an integral part of our eco-systems and without them multiple plant species that rely on them to be pollinators, may be under threat. Safeguarding their future could go a long way to protecting native British wildlife for future generations.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315431

attributes.action: Debate the catastrophic numbers of hedgehogs in road traffic accidents in the UK
attributes.background: Investigate the potential possibility of building wildlife highways to save our hedgehog and other wildlife population's dwindling numbers due to high levels of traffic. Also to explain our never ending thirst for concreting over our countries green spaces.
attributes.additional_details:
By mans never ending over-development of our countryside, we are unbalancing our fragile ecosystem and causing irreversible damage to our environment. 

This is all in the pursuit of man's greed and obsession with material wealth instead of sharing a wealth of our country's natural beauty.

rejection.details:
We think this petition is similar

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/550379

attributes.action: Ban fireworks for general sale to the public.
attributes.background:
I would like the Government to ban the sale of fireworks to the public. 
There should only be a public display of fireworks on special celebrations.
attributes.additional_details: Fireworks over the years are getting lounder and are sounding more and more like bombs going off. not only is this causing stress among veterans and the general public but also the wildlife and domestic animals.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319891

attributes.action: Create the worlds largest solar farm in the UK instead of building Disney Land.
attributes.background: I want the government to listen to David Attenborough and realise he has spent his whole life watching and speaking out about how us as humans are slowly ending the world as we know it. We need to act now and plant trees all over this country and ban Carbon emissions And learn to rebuild nature.
attributes.additional_details: There will be no government or parliament if we carry on. It will be the end of humanity and it’s not fair to our wildlife and us humans, we need to wake up! We have the tools, the knowledge and the power to act now. We have no excuse for how we go about our lives. This world is just as much belonging to wildlife as it is to us, we are all one. Each strand of grass and each leaf on every tree should matter, if we don’t act we won’t be able to reverse the fires Coming.

rejection.details: The Government is not responsible for Disneyland. We could accept a petition calling on the Government to increase funding for renewable energy, including solar, if that is what you want to happen.

attributes.action: Ban the use of Wildlife in Northern Irish Circus.
attributes.background: England, Scotland and Ireland have banned the use of wildlife in circuses under the Wild Animals in Circus Act 2019. Northern Ireland has yet to follow suit in tackling the manipulation and wildlife welfare issues in travelling circuses.
attributes.additional_details: The welfare of wildlife MUST be protected in order for there to be any future for wildlife at all.  We must protect the sanctity of wild animals and to end their suffering in Northern Ireland.

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Northern Ireland Assembly is responsible for. We can only accept petitions about things the UK Government or House of Commons are responsible.

If you would like to pursue you request you could contact your MLA or the Department of Agriculture, Environment and Rural Affairs (DAERA).

attributes.action: Give Hedgerows Statutory Legal Protection
attributes.background: Hedgerows are vital wildlife habitats corridors often connecting some of our most important ancient woodlands and wood pastures. For wildlife to maintain migratory routes and their daily foraging territories essential to life we believe they need the same protection as the afore mentioned habitats
attributes.additional_details:
Where intensive agriculture has decimated biodiversity across the countryside hedgerows remain as last refuges for many species of plant, fungi and invertebrate. That could easily be lost forever should these linear mini woodlands be lost or fail to function as they have done for centuries.
In circumstances where hedgerows have to be removed, especially ancient hedgerows, these corridors should be reconnected by hedge planting around the development site.

rejection.details:
We think this petition is similar:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549689

attributes.action: Protect Aberdeens Greenfern, Northfield against all current & future developers
attributes.background: Greenfern fields are a major part of our cities green belt and cultural heritage & is home to important protected wildlife. I walk there every day & enjoy watching Tawny owls, Bats, Red Kites & Sparrow Hawks & I have noticed signs of Badgers. Please help keep our green belt green & flourishing.
attributes.additional_details: The previous petition was stopped due to a general election, the petition mudt be re-posted. Developing this site means pushing Aberdeen's greenbelt even further out of the City. This site is home to many schedule 1 & 2 protected species which I have seen first hand. The site has high recreational value and is loved by locals, both young and old.  Dog walkers, bird watchers, families etc. love this site and it's part of the Northfield communities cultural heritage. The Council recently contracted Raeburn in for soil testing and further assessment which means the Council are looking to sell this land with such immense biodiversity value, to developers.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter the local authority and the Scottish Parliament.

attributes.action: Habitat Protection
attributes.background:
Three months before the proposed 1981 Wild Life and Countryside Bill went into parliament with Species Protection, the part containing Habitat Protection was taken out.

We need the government to add, Habitat Protection, to the 1981 Wildlife and Countryside Act
attributes.additional_details:
Through lack of Habitat Protection in the 1981 Act, some species, have lost, 90% of their population.

92% of Britain's wildlife has no Habitat Protection.

46%, of the Sites of Scientific Interest, have not been checked in the past 5 years.

G.B. has some 70,000 different species, 7000 of these, are in serious trouble.

A licence is required to hold a Bat or a Snake, but are you free, to chop down all the trees where a Bat feeds and breeds or burn all the grass, which the Snake calls home.

rejection.details:
There are already legal protections for animal habitats, including as a result of the Wildlife an Countryside Act 1981, and subsequent regulations.

For example, you can read the Government's guidance on protecting or bats here: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/bats-protection-surveys-and-licences

And you can read the Government's guidance about protections of reptiles here: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/reptiles-protection-surveys-and-licences

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to change the current protections for animal habitats, but it would need to be clear what changes you wanted the Government to make to current protections.

attributes.action: Start a national anti-litter campaign raising awareness across all age groups.
attributes.background: With the easing of lockdown has come the return of litter, suffocating landscapes and coastlines. I believe we need a national campaign to educate people of all ages on the consequences litter has for wildlife and the future of the planet, and that littering, in any form, is completely unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details: We need an advertising and education campaign targeted at the general public and schools, getting people to reevaluate their littering habits and to stop and think about the real life consequences of their actions; litter must be binned or taken home without exception. The next generation need to understand the detrimental effects it has on wildlife and to passionately believe it’s their duty to  not drop litter of any kind and contaminate the countryside. We only have one planet Earth, love it.

rejection.details:
We think this petition is similar:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324488

attributes.background: Reopen Zoo's so that these charitable organisations can continue to function and continue vital conservation work.
attributes.additional_details: It's unethical to allow all these animals to die when these organisations are carrying out non profit work to keep the conservation and preservation of wildlife going. allowing mainstream retailers to reopen when many people do not bother with social distancing guidelines is criminal when all this animal life is in jeopardy.

attributes.action: Let zoos, aquariums and wildlife parks open to the public in July 2020.
attributes.background: Zoos have been told to remain closed whereas attractions like theme parks can open in early July. Without visitor income, zoos cannot effectively care for their animals. As non-essential businesses are allowed to open, zoos should open too as it is essential to the welfare of captive animals.
attributes.additional_details: Opening zoos to the public will enable funding for conservation projects but most importantly the welfare of captive animals. Zoos need income to provide essentials such as food and veterinary care. It also pays staff who are vital for ensuring animal welfare. Zoos cannot survive on donations and previous government financial support which may cause zoo closures. If this happens, captive animals cannot be cared for and many will not be able to be returned to the wild as they will not survive.

attributes.background: To allow zoos ect to open as part of the economy getting back to normal. They will have to use social distancing measures yes but being mostly out side this should be easily done.
attributes.additional_details: Zoos wildlife parks and safaris all rely on visitors for at least 90% of there income which they haven't in lockdown. Yet they still need to feed the animals and pay staff to look after them as well as maintenance and so on. As beaches and non essential shops have been allowed to open why not these places. Lots of wildlife trust parks allowed to open why not zoos etc. It's easy to set up a 1 way system in these places in some places there is 1. As for distance and hygiene it's just as easy as national trust and easier than shops as it's out side with more room to move about.

attributes.action: Save Our Zoo’s
attributes.background: I want the government to reconsider their decision on adding zoo’s to the list of venues that are to remain closed indefinitely. Without visitors zoo’s are unable to survive and could be forced to close permanently. This would be a huge devastation and great loss to the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: I refer to both Chester and Twycross Zoo who have both reported significant debts that mount up to millions of pounds. Zoo’s provide so much support not only to wildlife and the environment, but also through the conservation projects that they carry out. Without immediate support our zoo’s are in great danger of becoming extinct themselves. I strongly urge you to reconsider your decision as a matter of urgency, before it’s too late.

attributes.action: Encourage employers to allow their employees to work from home
attributes.background: During lockdown there has been a massive reduction on air pollution, much of which must be down to more people working from home.
attributes.additional_details: Less air pollution for everyone, better health and less illness. Wildlife returning to areas where they been absent for many years. Less time travelling by car and public transport = a cleaner environment, less time travelling for the employee, less stress, more quality time with family due to wasted travelling time.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318057

attributes.action: Ban the use of disposable BBQ's in the countryside and all public outdoor spaces
attributes.background: I'm asking the government to put a ban on the use of disposable BBQ's in all public outdoor spaces. This would include national parks, open moorland, country parks, public beaches and all other public spaces.
attributes.additional_details: Disposable BBQ's not only are the cause of so many accidental fires and scorch marks causing damage to wildlife habitat's and fauna all across he country, they also have a massive part to play in litter pollution when left behind after use. Not only can they not be recycled or composted but also have sharp wire mesh that could injure or kill animals and the foil tray is a natural heat source when left in the suns rays causing a possible fire. Each fire cost thousands in resources to extinguish.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323233

attributes.action: Ban The Sale Of Disposable BBQ’S
attributes.background: To totally ban the sale of disposable BBQ’s. They are dangerous, start uncontrollable fires, are not able to be recycled, are left on beaches, woodland, countryside and are dangerous to livestock and wildlife.
attributes.additional_details: In Dorset we have just lost 190 hectares of forest and heathland in Wareham, put 150 firefighters lives at risk, and the cause? Disposable BBQ’s.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315762

attributes.action: Scrap HS2 and use the money to fund the NHS and elderly care
attributes.background: Use the money destined for HS2 to fund the NHS and elderly care.  This money would be better used for these causes which have been underfunded for years. Elderly care is disjointed and unfair on people who have saved their money.  Scrap Phase 2 of HS2 altogether and improve the rail network we have.
attributes.additional_details: By not building Phase 2 of HS2 and using the money for NHS and elderly care would ensure these causes would be adequately funded, the countryside and wildlife would be protected by not destroying woodlands and people would not be forced from their homes to make way for HS2, air quality would be improved and pollution lessened.  The abuse of nature would be less and people would be living in a better environment.  The rail network we have needs improving and this could be done at much less cost.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/311642

attributes.action: Stop the 5G rollout until independent testing proves it universally safe
attributes.background: For the government to stop the use and rollout of all 5G technology and the 5G radio wave spectrum until independent peer-reviewed long-termed research has been conducted that assures it is safe to humans, wildlife and environmental health.
attributes.additional_details: To provide an independent peer-reviewed, unbiased evidence base on the health consequences from long-term exposure for humans, wildlife or the natural environment. The government must stop this rollout until the long-term effects have been assessed for humans, and all fauna and flora.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312997

attributes.action: Keep our Pollution levels down after lockdown
attributes.background: Air pollution levels in the UK have dropped significantly since the country went into lockdown. Greenhouse Gas emissions have dropped by 60% in the UK from last year. From this we are observing cleaner air, more wildlife and clearer skies. This is better for our health and our environment.
attributes.additional_details: We want you to keep it this way, in this period we have come to realisation of how important our health is. The World Health Organisation claims cities with higher pollution rates are seeing more deaths from COVID-19. You have been taking action on the coronavirus from the science, why not do the same with our Climate?

rejection.details:
You might like to sign this petition instead:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317343

attributes.action: Ban use of Sky Lanterns in UK
attributes.background: Ban the use of, manufacture and sale of sky lanterns in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Sky lanterns have proven to be harmful and fatal to wild life, farm livestock, domestic animals and Zoo animals.  They are also a fire hazard and pose a risk to all properties, and are a huge drain on the resources of all our overstretched emergency services.  At the most fundamental level, they are littering, which usually incurs a fine if caught.
Night or sky lanterns have no place in the future of our country which seeks to encourage wildlife to thrive, whilst reducing unnecessary waste.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310556

attributes.action: Ban the setting-off of Chinese Lanterns in the whole of the UK
attributes.background: Chinese Lanterns pose such a threat to livestock, wildlife & farmland & property
attributes.additional_details: It is not appropriate to set these very dangerous Lanterns off in the UK at any time because of the threat to wildlife, livestock & property but particularly at this time when all the emergency services are under such a strain

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310556

attributes.action: Ban night sky lanterns
attributes.background:
People are campaigning for the sky to be littered with night sky patterns in support of the NHS
We are being encouraged to litter pollute and case untold damage to wildlife and animals in fields and potentially setting fire to horses wearing rugs, tress a shrubs 
These items need to be banned
attributes.additional_details: Because people are not thinking about the outcome of their use they are thinking ah lovely show our support to the NHS

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310556

attributes.action: Encourage homeworking for employees after COVID-19 to help save the planet.
attributes.background:
Encourage employers to allow employees to continue to work from home after COV-19 is under control.
If employees don't need to go into the office, letting them stay home if they want will continue to be beneficial.
I believe the old idea that homeworking is detrimental is wrong. It works!
attributes.additional_details:
Seemingly homeworking is working quite well, so encouraging homeworking after the virus is under control will help save the planet and give employees more choice. 
It'll mean: 
Pollution will be reduced as there will be less cars on the road enabling wildlife to recover.
People will be less stressed because they won't have to travel to work in congestion.
People will have a better work/life balance.

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/

attributes.action: Safeguard recovering wildlife now: create a positive Coronavirus Legacy
attributes.background: Globally Covid-19 lockdowns have had unexpected benefits for emerging and recovering wildlife. The UK Gov must act now to create new situation-relevant and proactive safeguarding measures and laws specific to ensuring a return to business as usual mitigates damage to habitats, marine and wildlife.
attributes.additional_details: We, the undersigned, request the UK Gov act now to baseline, create action plans and implement new laws and safeguarding measures to protect areas where nature is recovering or has potential to thrive in future due to a decline in human activity. Balance human, industrial and economic recovery with natural recovery, re-wilding and replenishing.  We ask the UK Government to include recovering species protection in its forward-planning to create a positive, world-leading green Coronavirus legacy.

Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Ban plastic dog poo bags and promote the use of a biodegradable alternative.
attributes.background:
I want a complete ban on the production and sale of plastic dog poo bags. 
As a keen environmentalist they are obviously a huge problem for me, wildlife and the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
I want a complete ban on the production and sale of plastic dog poo bags. 

As a keen environmentalist they are obviously a huge problem for me, wildlife and the environment.

I do regular litter picks and pick soo many used dog poo bags from out of trees and bushes, out of the canal or just on the road. It's a huge pollution issue that just doesn't really get mentioned. There are environmentally friendly, biodegradable alternatives available which need promoting if a ban gets implemented.

attributes.action: End the use of all snares in the UK: Make snares illegal to protect our wildlife
attributes.background: The UK’s precious wildlife is under threat due to private and commercial hunting. The government must make snares completely illegal in the UK to conserve our wildlife. Snares are used to protect other animals, but in doing so, they kill so many others - they don’t discriminate between species.
attributes.additional_details: In 2012 a UK government study revealed that only a quarter of animals trapped in snares were ‘intended targets’. Victims range from pheasants to pet dogs. Although all snares are dangerous, ‘free-running’ snares are legal in the UK and can be lethal and cause so much suffering. IPSOS MORI states that 80% of the British Public think that Fox Hunting should remain illegal. DEFRA suggests 1.7 million animals are trapped each year. The Conduct of Practice is not a solution, instead we need a ban.
